availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Montraville B. Goble (Lawrence County, Kentucky, court clerk and farmer.)

body.p: Lawrence County, Kentucky, court clerk and farmer. Lawrence County, Kentucky, native. Son of Green V. Goble and Rebecca Wilson Jones Goble. Married to Hester Ann Burgess Goble in Lawrence County on November 18, 1855. Father of Emma Goble, Jane B. Goble, George Goble, Dove Goble, and Alice M. Goble. Resident of Lawrence County in 1850. Household owned three enslaved persons in Lawrence County in 1850. Clerk of the Lawrence County Court in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in 1860. Farmer in Lawrence County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County, p. 80A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County, p. 333B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County, Louisa, p. 285B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Lawrence County, KY, October 1863, p. 149.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994044, Lawrence County Marriages.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 5538.
"M.B. Goble," Big Sandy News (Louisa, KY), March 10, 1911, p. 1.
